alert.note: Alert for George; Greene (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 10:56AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Monroe, northern Mobile, northwestern Baldwin, southeastern Washington, southeastern Clarke, northwestern Escambia, northeastern George and southeastern Greene Counties through 1145 AM CDT... At 1055 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of McIntosh to 3 miles south of Citronelle to near Lucedale. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Monroeville, Citronelle, Lucedale, Creola, Frisco City, Chunchula, Stockton, McCullough, Gulfcrest, Axis, Uriah, Calvert, Mount Vernon, McIntosh, I65 And AL 225 and Movico. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama.
